trans-unit.source: Represents the configuration section for cache behavior.
This class cannot be inherited.
This class corresponds to the [\<requestCaching\> Element (Network Settings)](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/network/requestcaching-element-network-settings.md) configuration element.
This class is used to access information about default caching behavior for resources requested by using the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebClient> classes.
This class provides programmatic access to information that can be stored in configuration files.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Configuration.RequestCachingSection"></xref> class.
Gets the default FTP caching behavior for the local computer.
A <xref href="System.Net.Configuration.FtpCachePolicyElement"></xref> that defines the default cache policy.
Gets the default caching behavior for the local computer.

Unless the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.RequestCachingSection.DisableAllCaching%2A> property is set to `true`, the policy returned by this property overrides the policy set in the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.RequestCachingSection.DefaultPolicyLevel%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Net.Configuration.HttpCachePolicyElement"></xref> that defines the default cache policy.
Gets or sets the default cache policy level.
A <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel"></xref> enumeration value.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that enables caching on the local computer.
If this configuration attribute is set to `true` in any configuration file, caching is disabled globally, and all other cache related settings are ignored.
In addition, caching cannot be enabled programmatically.
`true` if caching is disabled on the local computer; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the local computer cache is private.
On client machines, this value is typically set to `true` indicating that one user cannot use resources cached by another user.
For middle-tier applications, this value is typically set to `false`.
`true` if the cache provides user isolation; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value used as the maximum age for cached resources that do not have expiration information.
Setting this property ensures that a resource that does not have expiration header information does not remain fresh in the cache indefinitely.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that provides a default maximum age for cached resources.
